snippet: Opposition to coverage in health care reform continues, based on false religious liberty claims.
abstract: Editorial hails simplification of rule in Affordable Care Act that allows nonprofit religious organizations to opt out of direct contraception coverage for employees by providing comparable coverage from third-party insurers; decries ruling issued by United States Court of Appeals in Denver that found law violates freedom of for-profit employers by requiring them to cover birth control without co-pay.
lead_paragraph: Opposition to coverage in health care reform continues, based on false religious liberty claims.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
